September 2 at 12:19 PM ·

We had a great morning recording for Iheart Radio Podcast!! We will post the link once it’s finished for
“This is how we Planet” with host Charly Caruso! Thank you Nestle Waters North America for this opportunity!! The 4G team was featured with Michelle Wilson of the WWE and Make A Wish Foundation, Sky Beard with Child Hunger Florida and yours truly the 4G Beekeeping Team of Hawkins ISD! Our host was Charly Caruso with the WWE and ESPN! This was a great experience and these young ladies took a platform today that will reach out to over 250 million listeners! I’m proud of how they represented our community of Hawkins, our School District, the National FFA Organization and how Corporate America can create partnerships with local communities with our very own Ozarka Bottle Water facility!! These young ladies have a story to tell and we will post the link once the editing process is complete! We enjoyed listening in how other organizations such as Make a Wish and No Child Hunger impacts their communities as well. I think you will be inspired when you tune in!

post_text: Our 2019 Hawkins ISD yearbook will arrive soon. It was already very late, entirely due to technical issues on our part, when our publishing plant shut down for the pandemic (it is in Dallas County, which was under one of the earliest and strictest shutdown orders). Now that the plant is reopened, they are catching up on the backlog of projects to be printed and shipped. The good news... we made a very big change to our programs and processes this year that will ensure an end to our past technical issues, and the 2020 yearbook is on track for its scheduled delivery in August. It documents an amazing and unprecedented year, from the newly remodeled campuses to the home learning taking place in our final quarter. If you want to pre-order your copy, it's not too late! Go to balfour.com and use the box at the top to find "Hawkins High School" (you'll need to choose High School regardless of which campus your child attends)... click "Yearbook Products and Ads" and follow the next steps to reserve your copy of the 2020 yearbook.

Hawkins STEM
April 29, 2019 at 8:44 AM ·

These two young men--Dalton Wages and Colton Payne--have really impressed me this year as a teacher. They both created CO2-powered vehicles and at first glance, these might look like toys. However, there was an extreme amount of precision and detail that went into the designs of these two cars. They had to consider the aerodynamic principles of lift, thrust, friction, drag, fluid dynamics, and many other factors.

Even though I knew that they had submitted excellent work, I am still amazed that these two will now have a chance to travel to Washington D.C. this summer to race their cars at the national level! The top ten cars at state get to compete at the national level, and Colton and Dalton both placed in the top ten!

Very well done, guys!
